intro: Oligosporus adfinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sporegrass, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Poaceae family, commonly known as grasses, and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and compact inflorescence. The plant produces small, wind-dispersed spores rather than seeds, which is a unique reproductive strategy among grasses. Its growth is adapted to cool, moist environments with poor soil nutrients, making it a resilient yet elusive species. Due to habitat loss and climate change, Oligosporus adfinis is considered endangered and is the subject of ongoing botanical research.
